member.summary: No conditions are set on the created process.

member.name: F:System.Devices.ProcessCreationFlags.DebugProcess
member.summary: For Windows CE versions 2.0 and later. Calling process is treated as a debugger, and the new process is a process being debugged. Child processes of the new process are also debugged. The system notifies the debugger of all debug events that occur in the process being debugged.

member.name: F:System.Devices.ProcessCreationFlags.DebugOnlyThisProcess
member.summary: For Windows CE versions 2.0 and later. Calling process is treated as a debugger, and the new process is a process being debugged. No child processes of the new process are debugged. The system notifies the debugger of all debug events that occur in the process being debugged.

member.name: F:System.Devices.ProcessCreationFlags.CreateSuspended
member.summary: The primary thread of the new process is created in a suspended state.

member.name: F:System.Devices.ProcessCreationFlags.CreateNewConsole
member.summary: For Windows CE versions 3.0 and later. The new process has a new console, instead of inheriting the parent's console.

member.name: M:System.Devices.RemoteDevice.CreateProcess(System.String,System.String,System.Devices.ProcessCreationFlags)
member.summary: Runs a program on a remote device. It creates a new process and its primary thread. The new process executes the specified executable file.
member.param:
String that specifies the module to execute.
The string can specify the full path and file name of the module to execute or it can specify just the module name. In the case of a partial name, the function uses the current drive and current directory to complete the specification.

String that specifies the command line arguments with which the application will be executed.
The commandLine parameter can be NULL. In that case, the method uses the string pointed to by applicationName as the command line.
If commandLine is non-NULL, applicationName specifies the module to execute, and commandLine specifies the command line arguments.
Optional conditions for creating the process.

member.name: T:System.Devices.SortOrderFlags
member.summary: Sort flags. The default is ascending order and case-sensitive. Records that do not contain the sort property are placed after all other records.

member.name: F:System.Devices.SortOrderFlags.Default
member.summary: Default sort order.

member.name: F:System.Devices.SortOrderFlags.Descending
member.summary: Causes the sort to be in descending order. By default, the sort is done in ascending order.

member.name: F:System.Devices.SortOrderFlags.CaseInsensitive
member.summary: Causes thee sort operation to be case-insensitive. This value is valid only for strings.

member.name: F:System.Devices.SortOrderFlags.UnknownFirst
member.summary: Causes the sort opperation to place records that do not contain the sort property before all the other records.

member.name: F:System.Devices.SortOrderFlags.IgnorenOnSpace
member.summary: Specifies that this sort ignores nonspacing characters, such as accents, diacritics, and vowel marks. This value is valid only for strings.

member.name: F:System.Devices.SortOrderFlags.IgnoreSymbols
member.summary: Causes the sort operation to not recognize symbol values. This value is valid only for strings.

member.name: F:System.Devices.SortOrderFlags.IgnoreKanaType
member.summary: The sort does not differentiate between Hiragana and Katakana characters. This value is valid only for strings.

member.name: F:System.Devices.SortOrderFlags.IgnoreWidth
member.summary: Prevents the sort operation from differentiating between a single-byte character and the same character as a double-byte character. This value is valid only for strings.

member.name: F:System.Devices.SortOrderFlags.Unique
member.summary: Requires the key to be unique across all records in the database. This constraint also requires the sort property to be present in all records.

member.name: F:System.Devices.SortOrderFlags.NonNull
member.summary: Requires the sort property to be present in all records.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: Identifier of the property to be sorted on. Sorts on binary properties are not allowed.
Sort flags. See for more detail.

member.name: M:System.Devices.RemoteDatabase.#ctor(System.Devices.RemoteDevice,System.String,System.Boolean,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and opens an existing database in the object store on a remote MicrosoftÂ® WindowsÂ® CEâ€“based device.
member.param: The device.
Contains the name of the database to be opened.
If set to true current seek position is automatically incremented with each call to the ReadRecordProps method.

Property identifier of the primary key for the sort order in which the database is to be traversed. Subsequent calls to Seek assume this sort order. This parameter can be zero if the sort order is not important.

member.name: T:System.Devices.RemoteDatabase.DatabaseSeekType
member.summary: Specifies the type of seek operation to perform on a method call.

member.name: F:System.Devices.RemoteDatabase.DatabaseSeekType.CEOID
member.summary: Seeks until finding an object that has the specified object identifier. The dwValue parameter specifies the object identifier. This type of seek operation is very efficient.

member.name: F:System.Devices.RemoteDatabase.DatabaseSeekType.Beginning
member.summary: Seeks until finding the record at the specified position from the beginning of the database. The dwValue parameter specifies the number of records to seek from the beginning.

member.name: F:System.Devices.RemoteDatabase.DatabaseSeekType.End
member.summary: Seeks backward for the specified number of records from the end of the database. The dwValue parameter specifies the number of records to seek from the end.

member.name: F:System.Devices.RemoteDatabase.DatabaseSeekType.Current
member.summary: Seeks backward or forward from the current position of the seek pointer for the specified number of records. The dwValue parameter specifies the number of records to seek from the current position. The function seeks forward if dwValue is a positive value, or backward if it is negative.

member.name: F:System.Devices.RemoteDatabase.DatabaseSeekType.ValueSmaller
member.summary: Starting from the current position, seeks backward toward the start of the sort. Always seeks backward, regardless of sort order. In ascending order, this finds the largest value smaller than the specified value; in descending order, this finds the smallest value larger than the specified value. If none of the previous records has a value that meets the search criteria, the seek pointer is left at the end of the database and the function returns 0. The dwValue parameter is a pointer to a CEPROPVAL structure.

member.name: F:System.Devices.RemoteDatabase.DatabaseSeekType.ValueFirstEqual
member.summary: Begins at the start of the sort and seeks forward until finding the first value that is equal to the specified value. Always seeks forward, regardless of sort order. If the seek operation fails, the seek pointer is left at the end of the database, and the function returns 0. The dwValue parameter is a pointer to a CEPROPVAL structure.

member.name: F:System.Devices.RemoteDatabase.DatabaseSeekType.ValueGreater
member.summary: Starting from the current position, seeks backward toward the start of the sort. Always seeks forward, regardless of sort order. In ascending order this finds the smallest value greater than the specified value; in descending order this finds the largest value smaller than the specified value. If none of the following records has a value that meets the search criteria, the seek pointer is left at the end of the database and the function returns 0. The dwValue parameter is a pointer to a CEPROPVAL structure.

member.name: F:System.Devices.RemoteDatabase.DatabaseSeekType.ValueNextEqual
member.summary: Starting from the current seek position, seeks exactly one position forward in the sorted order and checks if the next record is equal in value to the specified value. If so, returns the object identifier of this next record; otherwise, returns 0 and leaves the seek pointer at the end of the database. This operation can be used in conjunction with the CEDB_SEEK_VALUEFIRSTEQUAL operation to enumerate all records with an equal value. The dwValue parameter is a pointer to a CEPROPVAL structure.
